Posts.Title: confused and scared jkeel dee1961

Posts.Content: Mar 26, 2009 01:36AM dee1961 wrote: For me it was from Monday afternoon to Wednesday afternoon. The first week wasn't too bad, I was still very numb from anesthetia. The second week was more difficult and painful. I still have drains and am not allowed to drive or work. I'm now in my third week(still have 2 drains) and just feeling like I may be ready to go back to work. I never slept in a recliner, I just propped up in the bed with more pillows. I get tired very easy and riding in a car is still not fun. Good luck to you, I hope you have a speedy recovery!

Posts.Content: Feb 18, 2009 03:03PM dee1961 wrote: Hi Ednazaid, I had a nodule(fibrodenoma) biopsied 11 years ago with B9 results. The docs always told me that fibros dont turn to cancer. Guess what? Yes they can. I had my routine mamo in November 08 and they found a calcifications in the middle of the old nodule that had bee biopsied before. They said almost 100% not cancer but just old scar tissue. Well It WAS cancer, so please know I'm not trying to scare you, but please think about getting a biopsy..doesnt hurt to be cautious. Let me know how things go for you and I pray you have B9 results! :) Dee

Posts.Content: Aug 10, 2009 12:08PM dee1961 wrote: I was the same size as you DVSB and had/have large dogs ears too. They left alot of skin for my reconstruction, but not sure why they would have left your skin unless you were unsure wether you wanted recon or not. Your insurance should have to pay for removal since they are part of the breast removal for your cancers. Propylatctic masts may not be covered. Check with your insurance co. Take care!

Posts.Content: Aug 13, 2009 07:32PM dee1961 wrote: Hi gonnabstrong, I was dx with DCIS and IDC stage TN1mic grade 3 ER+ PR- HER2+++ in Jan 09 after a lumpectomy. I ended up having bilateral mastectomies and so far that has been the extent of my treatment. You really will have to wait until you have the additional surgery to find out what stage your breast cancer is. I know the waiting stinks but you will get through this. Cry all you want and surround yourself with supportive family and friends. Take a deep breath and keep posting here, we are here for you. Dee~
Posts.Title: Just found out gonnabstrong cheranthia

Posts.Content: Feb 25, 2010 03:26PM - edited Feb 25, 2010 03:29PM by dee1961 Stacey, For me, other than being  bit woozy from the anesthesia that day, I felt fine. I was a but sore but never had to take anything more than Ibuprofen for pain. Just rest the day of the procedure and plan on going to the party. I cant give you 100% gaurantee that you will make it to the party, but I really don't think you should have too much of a problem with the lumpectomy. Again, good luck! :) Let us know what happens with your results.
